title.#cdata-section: Safety measures part of Aberdeen beach deaths probe

description.#cdata-section: The public safety measures in place at Aberdeen beach will be considered as part of an investigation into the deaths of a young boy and his mother.

title.#cdata-section: PFI schools built in Scotland 'owned by offshore firms'

description.#cdata-section: More than 200 schools built in Scotland under private finance schemes are at least partially owned by offshore investment funds, BBC Scotland finds.

title.#cdata-section: Kezia Dugdale backs Owen Smith as Labour Party leader

description.#cdata-section: Scottish Labour leader Kezia Dugdale backs Owen Smith to replace Jeremy Corbyn as Labour leader.

title.#cdata-section: New Royal Hospital for Sick Children in Edinburgh delayed

description.#cdata-section: The completion of a Â£150m children's hospital will be delayed for months after construction firms entered administration and provisional liquidation.

title.#cdata-section: Council group threatens court action against government

description.#cdata-section: A group of councils is threatening to take the Scottish government to court if ministers continue to freeze them out of funding talks.
A 16-year-old Peebles High School pupil becomes a community councillor, believed to be the youngest in Scotland.

title.#cdata-section: Dumfries summit studies key transport issues

description.#cdata-section: A summit is being held in Dumfries to examine the key transport issues facing the south west of Scotland.

title.#cdata-section: Edinburgh schools: 'Children shelter under that wall'

description.#cdata-section: Parents say it is too difficult to comprehend what might have happened if a school wall which fell in strong winds had come down during school hours.

title.#cdata-section: Car comes to rest on roof of Fiat 500 in Glasgow

description.#cdata-section: Police were called to an unusual sight in Glasgow's west end over the weekend after an unoccupied car ended up on the roof of another vehicle.

title.#cdata-section: Tay Road Bridge designer commemorated in mural

description.#cdata-section: The designer of the Tay Road Bridge is commemorated in a mural celebrating the crossing's 50th anniversary.

title.#cdata-section: Scotland's papers: SNP-Labour pact 'ruled out' and beach tragedy

description.#cdata-section: Jeremy Corbyn "rules out" an alliance with the SNP and the tragedy at Aberdeen beach feature on Scotland's front pages.

title.#cdata-section: Scottish Gossip: Roberts, Celtic, Rodgers, McGinn, Tavernier

description.#cdata-section: Brendan Rodgers says the transfer market will "explode" for his Celtic team if they reach the Champions League...
BBC Scotland's Kheredine Idessane reflects on a record-breaking Olympics for Scottish athletes representing Team GB.
